turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Let's hear from you, you goddam Yankee. Be nice to see you some time.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Like the Spearchucker said, that's possible. Anyway, it's been an interesting association.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: There's no point appealing to Colonel Blake. They've got him bewitched.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No. The only thing to do is write General Hammond.  But it's hard to find a place around here for a private discussion.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: I have a tent to myself.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: People will talk.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: I don't mind. If we give them something to talk about.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: I think it's a marvelous letter.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We're a good team.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: We think the same way.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's supper time.  But you're not hungry are you?

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Ravenous. What about you?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Well, sure, if you are, Margaret...

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Anyway, we want to get this letter off.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Godless buffoons, all of them.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: It's that disrespect for you, that's what I can't forgive them.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Oh, I'm used to it. What makes me sore is how they behave towards you.  They ought to be grateful to have you.  I certainly am.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: And I'm grateful for you, Frank, especially with those boors around. We've grown very close in a short time.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Frank...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't stop now! Please...

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Wait a second...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I can't... couldn't.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Is that liquor?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Finest kind. We're training Ho-Jon to be a bartender. Join us?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Give us this day our daily...

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You ever caught this bread, and forgive our syndrome before, Duke?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: ...trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: ...And for our young men on the field of battle, that they may return home to their dear ones...

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Come clean with us, Frank. Were you on this religious kick back home, or did you start to crack up here on the post?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: ...And for our Supreme Commander over here and our Commander-in-Chief in Washington.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I was just asking...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Shut up or I'll tear you apart.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: If we had closer relations, there wouldn't be any misunderstandings. That's where a football game would help. Between your outfit and mine.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: A football game?

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: Special Services in Tokyo are all for it. They say it's one of the main gimmicks we have to keep the American way of life going here in Asia.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: But what about Major Houlihan?

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: You mean Hot Lips? Screw her.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: N-n-no thanks, G-General.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: The hell we won't! You bastards pulled something, I don't know what, but we've been beating you without him. Ane we'll go on beating you!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You willing to b-back that up with odds?

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: Damn right. Three to one, as much as you want to put up.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Gimme three.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: At ease. Captain Pierce, you have a seriously wounded patient for whom you are responsible. Yet I find you in a poker game.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You betcher ass, Dad.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: Pierce! That soldier requires immediate attention. I'm a surgeon and I know.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You betcher ass, General.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I'm going to play poker until three a.m. or until the patient is ready for surgery. However, if you'd like to operate on him yourself right now, be my guest. I get the same dough whether I work or not.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: I want to talk to you, Pierce.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: There's nothing to talk about, General. You take the case yourself or join me at three o'clock. Either way you're liable to learn something.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Now, General, I'm going to sandbag you. Do you think we're ready to get out of this belly?

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: Obviously you don't think so, and I don't know why.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Well, Dad, we haven't found any holes in the large bowel. They've all been in the small bowel, but the smell is different. I caught a whiff of large bowel, but it ain't staring us in the face, right?

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: So if it ain't staring us in the face, it's got to be retroperitoneal. And that, along with the look of the wounds, makes me figure he's got a hole in his sigmoid colon that we won't find unless we look for it.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: And there it is.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: I'm impressed, Pierce. Naturally, the kind of job I have, I don't get much chance to keep up with what goes on in the OR.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Neither does Henry Blake. But I'll tell you what makes him the best C.O. you've got in any of your hospitals. He leaves all the medical decisions to the men who do the day- to-day work and understand what meatball surgery is.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Well, it's still pretty much in the talk stage.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: We had a team at the 325th Evac last fall. I coached the boys myself.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I think I heard about that.

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: Now we're working out a schedule of the outfits we're going to play this year. We all chip into a pool and make bets.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Must be fun. But the point we want to make about Henry...

turns.speaker: GENERAL HAMMOND
turns.text: I'm sure we could find a date for your team. Why don't I take it up with Henry?  Thanks for the drink, boys.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I only wanted to know what she's like in the sack. Do those big boobs hold up or are they kind of droopy?

turns.speaker: RADAR
turns.text: Hawkeye's asking the Major's opinion on a point of anatomy.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Also I'm curious whether she's a moaner or...

turns.speaker: RADAR
turns.text: A-negative. I've cross-matched it.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I though you said we didn't have a drop.

turns.speaker: RADAR
turns.text: I found a doner.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Radar!

turns.speaker: RADAR
turns.text: All you have to do is ask.  The quarterback is saying they'll run the old Statue of Liberty. Their left end will come across and take the ball out of his hand and try to get around our left end.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: We need medical officers for short- arm inspection starting the first afternoon out.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Oh, certainly, Sergeant. My name is Captain George Limburger, and this is Captain Walter Camembert.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: B-E-R-T, right. See you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: Oh, I'm not sailing with you. I work out of the hospital here.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I think I've seen this nut somewhere.  Haven't I?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: If you don't know what you've seen, why should I?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: That's the front up the road a few miles. We have to get by without some of the comforts of home.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: I like an olive.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Lucky you didn't have your mouth open or it would have gone down your throat.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: He's Trapper John! Only man in history who ever found fulfillment in the ladies' can of a Boston and Maine Railroad car! When the Conductor caught him in there with his Winter Carnival date, she screamed: 'He trapped me!' What have you been doing since those days, Trapper?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: What are they peeking at? Captain Waldowski in the shower?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Part of him. Painless is the owner and operator of the Pride of Hamtrack. That's where he comes from... Hamtrack, Michigan.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: ...But I turned in my knee pads.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Ho-Jon, give the Father some more martini.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Black capsule.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: The black capsule. Finest kind. Thank you, Dr. McIntyre.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: We're throwing him a Last Supper. We came to invite you.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: The Painless Pole plans to cross the Great Divide tonight and we need your help to straighten him out.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Or you can let him knock himself out. You personally'd be sending him to his grave.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: An eternal damnation.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: We stand behind all our work.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You want it straight? Medical history records no instance of anyone taking this particular prescription and surviving.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: It's a bedroom where a man is always at his peak and doesn't have to take any time outs.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: And all the angels are built like Lieutenant Dish.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Very well, Your Majesty.  Congratulations, Frank. He picked you.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: No, no, that one.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Oh, you want to play it straight?  I guess I owe you an apology.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I came within about ten yards of you. You know something, Trapper, the way we been going, if we ever got to see a real golf course again, I bet we could burn it up.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: As far as the greens maybe. I don't know if my putting would come back or not, without some practice.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I'm not so sure the goddam thing's in his heart.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: 'Course it isn't, but how many chances do we get to go to Japan? With our golf clubs.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Let me translate. I've had some exposure to the language. The young man is from Brooklyn and he wants us to vacate this vehicle.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: But weren't you supposed to meet the surgeons who are going to slice up the Congressman's son?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: But besides the operation, we've got to get in at least eighteen holes of golf.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: So let's haul ass, Sergeant.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Beautiful. What do you think? Should we stop and play nine holes now and operate on the kid later? If he's still alive.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Don't worry, son. That's Captain McIntyre, and he's the best chest surgeon in the Far East and maybe in the whole U.S. Army. He'll fix you up fine. Your daddy saw to that.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Just like we thought, it's a routine problem. Nurse, who's in charge of operating room preparations?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Did I ever tell you about Me Lay Marston?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Your high school friend who went around saying 'Me lay, you lay?' to all the young females in the community. As I remember, you said it was quite a successful approach.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Well, he wouldn't score more than once in seven or eight tries, but the important thing was he didn't waste time socializing. Anyway, Trapper John, this is Me Lay.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Please!  Face it, Colonel, you don't have us, we have you. Your boys blew this case, we bailed you out. We figure we ought to hang around a day to check the Congressman's kid, and we also figure to play some golf. So if that's okay with you, we got a deal.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: And if it isn't, why don't we call Washington on your telephone? You tell your story, we'll tell ours.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: When you make up your mind, get in touch. The golf club is probably the best place to leave a message.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Come on, Trapper. We got to forget golf for today.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: I don't know why. As long as it's light enough to see your caddie.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What's the age of consent in this country?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Is he out?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Like the Rock of Gibraltar.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Best thing you could do for all of us is grab some sack time.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Radar!

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: For you, Trapper.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Okay, but I'll need you to help. Duke, will you take that belly back there? The Australian?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It's in pretty deep.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Yeah, and he's lost a lot of blood. I'm afraid it's hit more that just the lung.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Christ, it's Ho-Jon!

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Hiya, Ho-Jon. You got a piece of a shell in your chest, but we'll take it out as soon as you've had more blood. Hey, Radar!

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: If we squeeze him through, I'm going to get him into Androscoggin College.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: How about squeezing him through into Dartmouth? If all he wants to do is catch lobsters, he can learn that here.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Dartmouth's too big and too expensive. If he's as good as I think he is, he can move into the big league later. But Androscoggin first.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: We'll need room. The sixth rib goes.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Never mind the conversation. Do it, Dad.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: You aspirate the blood from the chest cavity. Damn, there's more of it than I thought.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: If we don't get that pint, he's in trouble.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I don't feel anything.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: I can't feel it now either. The mother must have gone in.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: It was in the cava and the hole sealed itself off. I must have jiggled it just enough to turn it loose. I can't feel it in the heart or the right pulmonary artery. So it's in the left pulmonary artery.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: We'll have to close this hole and make one on the other side.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Be kind of rough on him if there's no blood. Why don't we close up and sit on him a couple of days?

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Sure, that's the right way... at John Hopkins or someplace. But how do we know there won't be even more of a jam-up a few days from now? Maybe we won't be able to get to him when we want to. Maybe the goddam thing'll erode the artery when nobody's looking. Our best shot is now.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: It's five minutes into nurses' shower hour. Where are they?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: They're coming.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: But he's got five times the man-power to draw on.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: We can balance that by getting ourselves a ringer. Henry has to say he needs a neurosurgeon and put in a specific request for Dr. Oliver Harmon Jones.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: He only lasted one season.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: On account he got caught in the doctor draft. He was a surgical resident playing semi-pro ball weekends when the Eagles signed him.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: So what makes you think he'll play for us?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: We'll cut him in on the bets we make. And still have enough profit to send Ho-Jon to college.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Might make kind of a social issue, not having any other Negro officer.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: He can move in here with us.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: But we'd have to break his leg or something to keep him out of the game for good.

turns.speaker: TRAPPER
turns.text: Not necessarily.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Captain Pierce, would I be imposing...?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Honey, nobody as pretty as you could ever impose... please sit down. Coffee?

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Captain, I've been observing the nurses on your shift. But naturally your own opinion is more informed than mine.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I'm glad you feel that way, Major, because you see it's a team effort... doctors, nurses, enlisted men... and I feel responsible for my whole team, and I want you to know I'm satisfied with them.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: All of them?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: That's right. We work well together.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: Major Burns is far from satisfied.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: That don't surprise me. If you're a good observer, you must have observed by now that Frank Burns is a jerk.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: On the contrary, I've observed he's not only a good technical surgeon, he's a good military surgeon. And that includes how a man dresses and how he bears himself and his sense of what it means to be an officer in the United States Army.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: And his track record, that don't count? Look, honey, when you watch the two shifts try to notice which one does the most work with the least fuss.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: I've noticed that both nurses and enlisted men address you as 'Hawkeye.'

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It's my name. Maybe that sounds silly to you but...

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: That kind of familiarity is inconsistent with maximum efficiency in a military organization.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Okay, Major, honey.  I'm going to have a couple shots scotch and go to bed. I'd normally ask you to join me but obviously you're a female version of the routine Regular Army clown. And that turns me off, so just leave my outfit alone and we'll get along fine.  See you around the campus.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: I wonder how a degenerated person like you could have reached a position of responsibility in the Army Medical Corps.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Sister, if I knew the answer to that I sure as hell wouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Hey, Knocko, I got those pictures you promised to look at of my kids. You too, Wilma. It won't take a minute.  You can see them too, if you want.

turns.speaker: HOT LIPS
turns.text: No, thank you. I'm not the slightest bit interested.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Listen, we look pretty lousy out there, right?

turns.speaker: SPEARCHUCKER
turns.text: Well, for college players that have been out of training seven or eight years...

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I'm thinking about how we can make more money.  Suppose we bet only part of our dough and keep this big animal out of the game the whole first half and let them roll up some points. Then you could bet the rest of our bundle between the halves and get the General and his friends to give us some real odds.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: The bastards outconned us.

turns.speaker: SPEARCHUCKER
turns.text: I think we could still have a chance.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: If you start the game instead of waiting, you mean?

turns.speaker: SPEARCHUCKER
turns.text: No, let's stick to that strategy till we see whether you boys can do two things. The first is get that halfback out of the game. He had one year with the Rams before the Army got him, but he didn't play too often because he's one of those hot dogs.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: SPEARCHUCKER
turns.text: We may be in trouble, I can't catch my breath. I've got the occupational disease of oversized ex-athletes.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: See you.

turns.speaker: SPEARCHUCKER
turns.text: It's possible

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Hang in there.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Isn't this ridiculous, Doctor? Six months I've been here and there are still times when I can't stand it. I just go to pieces.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: There's nothing ridiculous about it.  A kid like you...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Thank you, Captain Pierce.  It's been so long.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: No trouble at all.  Hawkeye.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: How did you get called that?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: 'The Last of the Mohicans.' Only book my father ever read.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You're getting a workout, you and Captain Forrest, your first night.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It isn't always this rough?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Oh, no. We have dull stretches every week or so, thank God, when there's nothing to do after midnight.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: They don't have to be dull. I mean if you and me put our minds together...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Our minds?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: For a start. I just have a hunch... well, it isn't entirely a hunch...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You're an attractive man.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You have a certain modest charm yourself.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: But I'm married.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Something else we have in common.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Very happily married.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Same here.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: And absolutely determined to be faithful to my husband. Do we have that in common, Captain?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It's a matter of definition. Faithful in spirit, yes.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: I don't make the distinction. But the sex urge is a powerful force. In women just as much as men.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Ayuh.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You'd think now, with only six weeks before they ship me back home, it would be easier. But it isn't.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: It's terribly hard. Sometimes the temptation is just too much.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Then why not, as long as it wouldn't hurt anybody...?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: But you've made me feel strong again, Captain. Hawkeye.  You helped me pull together when I needed it.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Even if I weren't.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Maria...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: I couldn't have slept tonight anyhow.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You're leaving tomorrow?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: In less than twelve hours I'll be on my way.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: That's when the real strain starts. Three weeks on a troopship.  Poor baby.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Dear, sweet Hawkeye.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Though I guess who it'll really be rough on is your husband.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You're on his side all of the sudden?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: A man would be more considerate. He wouldn't come home to his wife a nervous wreck.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: How would he avoid it... as if I needed to ask?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It could be a purely impersonal thing. What matters is the therapeutic value of relieving your tensions.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You should have been a marriage counselor.  But I'll show you what's wrong with your theory.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: Do you think anything between us could be impersonal? Or pure? You better forget logic, because you're proving why I shouldn't go to bed with you.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I didn't mean with me.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You're asking for somebody else?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It happens to be a matter of life and death.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: A man is going to die if he doesn't have my fair young body?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Precisely, Maria. Tonight you have the same privilege that comes on rare occasions to the chief executive of some state or nation... the privilege of restoring life, by one tender act of mercy, to a doomed fellow creature.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: He should come to now for a while, but he's got so much dope in him by tomorrow he won't know fact from fantasy.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: You think he won't.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What do you care? You'll be on your way to Japan.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: I'm fond of Painless, and I'd feel terrible if anything happened to him...

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: It's your decision, Maria. I don't want to high-pressure you.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT DISH
turns.text: I'd be crazy to think my virtue, such as it is, was more important than his life...

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: In fact I'd rather not try to influence you at all.  Let's just go in and take a look, and then you think it through for yourself.

turns.speaker: KOREAN DOCTOR
turns.text: You please excuse...  I have been making examination of this young man to find if he will be soldier in our army.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Yes, I know. Hi, Ho-Jon. How did it go?

turns.speaker: KOREAN DOCTOR
turns.text: I don't liking it at all, what I hear when I listen to the heart. And such a blood pressure for so young a boys. Is frightening.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that. You think he's unfit for military service?

turns.speaker: KOREAN DOCTOR
turns.text: At first is no doubt. But then I am seeing on his paper he work in American hospital. And I think there are so many drugs in such a places, he could take some by mistake.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Why would he do that?

turns.speaker: KOREAN DOCTOR
turns.text: Who is knowing? But the drug I have find in his urine is solving all mysteries. By tomorrow will be gone his fast heart and high blood pressure. So I think maybe you will like to tell him goodbye. Okay?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Two-man job. How much blood has he had?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT SCORCH
turns.text: Second pint.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Duke...

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT SCORCH
turns.text: It was really nice of you to take me along.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I didn't have much choice.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT SCORCH
turns.text: You really say the cutest things.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: SECOND MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: Captain Camembert! Captain Camembert!

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Excuse me, Sergeant.

turns.speaker: SECOND MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: Yes, Reverend?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What do you want with those two medical officers?

turns.speaker: SECOND MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: They're supposed to hold short-arm inspection.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Be the longest short-arm inspection you ever held!

turns.speaker: SECOND MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: Thanks, Reverend. Thank you both for tipping me off.  You don't know a Captain Forrest or a Captain Pierce, do you?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: They missed the boat.

turns.speaker: SECOND MEDICAL CORPS SERGEANT
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Glad to help.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: He's the pro from Dover and I'm the Ghost of Smokey Joe.

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: Save that crap for the rest of the clamdiggers back home.

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: The real Trapper John? The one who threw you the famous pass and went to greater glory on the Boston and Maine Railroad?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: The one and only.

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: Proud to know you, Trapper. Like to shake your hand if you'll hurry up and get that chest closed.  You still working the trains?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You don't go after the local scrunch?

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: I'm too busy, actually. Not for the Army, of course, but where I live. Dr. Yamachi's New Era Pediatric Hospital and Whorehouse. I'm serious. The guy has this crude hospital for kids and a whorehouse on the side to finance it, all in the same building.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What do you do in the joint besides pimp?

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: That's about the only thing I don't do Â– that I'm built for. I inspect the girls and take care of some of the kids in the hospital. Sometimes I tend bar and act as bouncer.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Why can't you look at him?

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: I have but well, you know, I've been mainly an anesthetist a long time now and... well, I'd like you guys to take a look at him.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What's the story?

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: Well, one of the girls got careless and two days ago she gave birth to an eight-pound American-Japanese male.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: Every time we feed him, it either comes right back up or he coughs and turns blue and has a hell of a time.

turns.speaker: ME LAY
turns.text: He's coming to.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Let's get his clothes off quick.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: Glad to know you. Drop in at my clinic anytime you feel like playing a little poker, or even if a tooth is bothering you.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Poker sounds great. When do you play?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: If a man isn't a man anymore, what's he got left to live for?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Tell me the whole story, Walt.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: There's this native broad works in the laundry. I don't know if you've noticed.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: There's only one worth noticing.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: You noticed. I wasn't going to fool around over here. I've got these three girls I'm engaged to back home...

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: But I had this feeling I ought to make the effort. To test myself. And I flunked.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: What did you have to test, for God's sake... the dental Don Juan of Detroit?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: Don Juanism is just a cover... I've been reading up on it.  I'm a fake, I'm a fraud, I've been living a lie!

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Painless, you mustn't talk that way. It's a lot of crap. Cover for what?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: Homosexuality.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: Now I know that's been my problem since I was a kid. But it only caught up to me last night.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You've been drawn to other males? Since you were a kid?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: No, never in the slightest.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Just in dreams?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: Or in dreams either. I repressed it completely. Classic pattern of inhibition.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: That's what you've been doing all these years with every dame you could lay your hands on? Repressing your real self?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: But it's all over now, and I can't face it. Imagine if you found out you were one, you wouldn't like breaking the news to your wife. Well, I got the same problem multiplied.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You don't have any problem. You've got thirty good years ahead of you, easy. Maybe you'll have to cut down as you grow older, get along with just two fiancees, but...

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: No, one thing I finally know for sure, I'll never function with a woman again.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: That's really what I came here for. See what you guys recommend.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Well, I'm sure my colleagues will agree there are a number of dependable measures for extinguishing the vital forces.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: In the direction you want to go.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: You guys got any black capsules?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: How much time do I have?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Just about enough to say goodbye to everybody.  Line up over here, men, if you want to pay your last respects. Keep moving and file on out when you're through.

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: I wonder, if Red's fix swings it for me, what's heaven really like?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Morning Painless. How they goin'?

turns.speaker: PAINLESS
turns.text: Big day. Two jaws to rebuild.

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: Good morning, Captain Pierce and Captain Forrest.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: You can cut the bow.

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: I have not understood what you means.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: That. It's out of the act.

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: Officer all sleep now, yes? And I go wash clothes.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Right, Ho-Jon. See you later.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Hi, Ho-Jon. How they goin'?

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: Finest kind. Captain Forrests say you better haul ass home quick. We got new chest-cutter in our tent.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: There ought to be a law against dentists reading. Matter of fact, I thought there was. Anyway, this is an obsession. He can't be persuaded out of it.

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: He's comin' this-a-way! The jaw- breaker!

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: And if I go to New York, the natives there will carry me? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: I don't think so either.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Pain bad, Ho-Jon?

turns.speaker: HO-JON
turns.text: I Â– wouldn't Â– wish Â– it Â– on Â– a Â– maneating Â– shark.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I'm Colonel Blake. You fellows just passing through?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Nope, we're assigned heah.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: The blonde dish.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: If you mean...  She is a lieutenant in the Army Nursing Corps, Captain.

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: Okay, Lieutenant Dish. I guess she's already... involved with somebody here.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: They've all tried. Nobody's got to first base.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You don't aim to cause any trouble Â– But?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: But we strongly suspect something will happen to screw up this splendid organization of yours if you don't get that sky pilot out of our tent.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Your tent?

turns.speaker: HAWKEYE
turns.text: We'll find out what they are when you throw us out.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: That's all the commitment you're offering me?  Or do you have some more extravagant gesture of cooperation?
